To reproduce:

* download distribution from www.atlassian.com
* unpack targ.gz
* run bin/start-confluence.sh

I'd have expected an error message when first trying to access the instance, telling me that the home dir hasn't been set. The page displayed instead is not very helpful.

The error message is in the console log, but somewhat buried under the subsequent stacktraces.
fields.summary: Not setting the home dir on a fresh install leads to unhelpful error message

fields.description: The problem happened because JIRA when communicates with Confluence for rendering the gadget using OAuth, JIRA always thinks the stored OAuth access token has been expired so it always tries to contact Confluence for a new access token. However in Confluence whenever a new access token request comes it will creates a new token and stores it into database. It causes very heavy database access to insert the new token and delete the old one. It also cause the problem that we have so many stored tokens in database. Because we have limited number of connections stored in the connection pool so when the pool saturated (heavy db operations happen for tokens deleting and storing) the blocking also go up to Tomcat threads.
fields.summary: Confluence Gadget using OAuth mode always calls to generate new access token and store it into database because of the OAuth access token has been expired

fields.description:
When using Confluence Mobile, a user will navigate to a page and it will see a spinning loading page. This loading page will never finish. At this point flushing either {{Web Resource Keys And Condition State Set}} or {{Web Resource Keys Condition List}} and have the user reload the page. At this point it will load it successfully.

After testing, we found this always occurs when a user looks at a Confluence page that does not have a note macro, followed by a page that has certain macros. It will always cause this issue.

h3. Reproduction steps:
# Install Confluence
# Create a page
## Give this page a title (Ex. Page 1)
## Save it with no content
# Create a second page
## Give this page a title (Ex. Page 2)
## Use the note macro to create a note, with any text in it (Ex. "This is a note")
## Save this page
# Force your browser to use the mobile interface by going to <base_url>/plugins/servlet/mobile#dashboard/
# Open Page 1
# Go back to the dashboard
# Open Page 2
# See the Loading Screen and wait for however long you would like (it will never finish loading)
# Go to the Cache Statistics page (in another tab)
# Flush either {{Web Resource Keys And Condition State Set}} or {{Web Resource Keys Condition List}}
# Go back to the tab with the mobile interface, hit refresh, the page will load. 

h3. Expected behavior
Page 2 loads, and you see the page with the note macro

h3. Actual behavior
Page 2 never loads, if you try to navigate to any other page (including back to the dashboard) it will still be stuck on the loading page. At this point, the cache needs to be flushed (either flush all, {{Web Resource Keys And Condition State Set}}, or {{Web Resource Keys Condition List}}.

h3. Macros That Cause This Behavior
* Table Of Contents
* Children Display
* Info
* Code
* Expand
* Note

h3. Macros That Do Not Cause This Behavior
* Panel
* Status

h3. Related Notes
* This can be worked around by either:
** Removing all note macros from Confluence
** Setting the {{Web Resource Keys Condition List}} cache to 1. This will slow down Confluence (as resources aren't cached) and occasionally you will encounter the loading screen but it will resolve itself.
** Flushing the cache when a user complains that they get the loading screen
* You can find a workaround at [Pages Stuck on Loading Screen When Using Confluence Mobile|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Pages+Stuck+on+Loading+Screen+When+Using+Confluence+Mobile]
fields.summary: Confluence Mobile Will Not Load Pages until the Cache Is Flushed

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35784].
  {panel}

Twice recently I have discovered that a user accidentally started a full space export. This can consume a lot of resources if the space is very large. We don't want to remove space export permissions, because being able to export a few pages is useful and is the only way, so far as I know, to export page comments. I would like to suggest improvements that would help prevent accidental full space exports.

Any or all of these improvements would help:
* Pop up a confirmation dialogue before starting a full space export (either a Normal export or a Custom export with all pages selected) to make sure that's really what the user wanted to do.
* Provide a configuration option to specify the maximum number of pages that can be exported using space export.
* Provide the ability for the user who started it or an admin to cancel a space export which is in progress.
fields.summary: Prevent accidental full space export

fields.description:
We run our application within a secured zone. Users can access the system via Tivoli Access Manager. This works fine for 99,9% of all use cases. The concept looks like this:
User requests -> Tivoli Access Manager -> Loadbalancer -> Confluence

However, we found out that confluence has changed the call of multimedia files.

Before (Conf 3.5.13), we were able to render e.g. flash files on a page, because all calls we linked to the base url (in our case the url of the tivoli access manager).

On the newer versions (Conf 5.5.6) the call could not be completed and will be aborted, because the call will try to access the server directly. This is not possible on our environment due to our security zone concept.

Is there a fast way to fix this issue? 

We are running confluence for 130.000 users and would appreciate a fast fix!

Thanks in advance!

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35760].
  {panel}

*Background of The Request*

Customers might choose the option to use CONNECTOR method instead of DELEGATION as they want the group membership retrieval process and authentication into two processes instead of at the same time. Since CONNECTOR retrieve group membership using the LDAP synchronisation process, it is not necessary to retrieve the group membership during authentication process as well.

By forcing user membership retrieval during authentication process could cause performance issue during authentication process. Especially if customer is using SSL connection due to this [bug|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-35735]. This authentication performance issue will get worst if nested group membership is enabled.

*Propose Solution*

Provide an option for administrators to skip user membership retrieval during authentication in the directory configuration.
fields.summary: Provide an option to ignore group membership update during authentication for CONNECTOR

Following the links until there is no "next" in the result, Confluence returns only 300 entries from a space which contains 342 pages.

Using the JSON-RPC API returns all pages without a problem.

When I tried to repeat the queries "manually" using execution of multiple "curl" calls I got back more entries but many were duplicates.

I think this likely has something to do with restrictions and the PaginationService

Hi,

We are in the process of making sure OriginalTheme will be up to date with the 5.7 release. Right now we are testing agains the m22 version. We have some problems regarding the inline comments editor, the popup with the button does not show up when I highlight text. 

The cause of this seems to be that the area the highlighter looks in is selected using $(".wiki-content").first(), whereas we render content in multiple containers with that class-name.

We had a similar problem with the jira issue creator in confluence 5.4, and we received a javascript snippet (which let us specify another selector) to fix it that time. Could we get a similar fix for this, or do you have any other suggestions?

Best Regards,
Andreas
RefinedWiki

fields.description:
LDAP connections over SSL are not pooled, meaning each operation acquires a new TCP connection as well as negotiating SSL. This significantly increases the time taken for operations like synchronization. This can also cause sluggish login times.

*Workaround for improving the Synchronization Time:*
Albeit not a workaround for the problem pooling connections, the following might improve the synchronization time:
# Edit the LDAP directory:
# On _Use the User Membership Attribute_, under *Membership Schema Settings*, please:
## Uncheck 'When finding the members of a group';
## Check 'When finding the user’s group membership'.
# Synchronize the directory.

*Workaround for improving the login time:*
The following can be added to force the JVM to pool SSL connections. Add the following line to your Apache Tomcat /bin/setenv.sh ({{setenv.bat}} for Windows) file. Revert the changes if we encounter any start-up issues or login times do not improve.
On Linux:
{code}
JAVA_OPTS="$JAVA_OPTS -Dcom.sun.jndi.ldap.connect.pool.protocol='plain ssl' -Dcom.sun.jndi.ldap.connect.pool.authentication='none simple DIGEST-MD5'"
{code}

On Windows:
{code}
JAVA_OPTS=%JAVA_OPTS% -Dcom.sun.jndi.ldap.connect.pool.protocol="plain ssl" -Dcom.sun.jndi.ldap.connect.pool.authentication="none simple DIGEST-MD5"
{code}
fields.summary: Pool SSL LDAP connections

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35730].
  {panel}

h2. Problem summary
Since Confluence 5.4, it is possible create JIRA issues by highlighting text on a Confluence page. A dialog will pop-up over the highlighted text, with an option to create a comment from the quote, or to create an issue in JIRA.

However, we've observed instances where the Create JIRA option is missing (but the comment-from-quote option is still there) seemingly intermittently, without explicit change to the system from users or administrators.

h2. Troubleshooting
There can be more than one cause for this Create JIRA ticket option to not appear with text highlights:
* The plugin {{Confluence and Jira Content Connector}} might be disabled
* The plugin {{Page Highlight Actions}} might be disabled
* The individual user might have the "Show option panel when text is selected" setting unchecked in {{Profile > Settings}}

However, in the cases Support has observed, these avenues have already been explored. There are no errors in logs or in the UI, and the intermittent nature makes this issue particularly difficult to troubleshoot. The JIRA icon is simply missing when text is highlighted.

h2. Steps to reproduce
This issue is intermittent, and we do not have clear steps to reproduce. However, the problem appears to be with the in-memory cache.

h2. Workaround
We've found that the problem may be related to an in-memory cache store, and some customers have had success getting the functionality back by flushing the cache (via {{Confluence Admin > Cache Management (or Cache Statistics) > Flush all}}). Restarting Confluence may also restore the functionality.

ALSO:
Running a Content Index from Confluence administration >> Content indexing >> Rebuild, will clear this out.

(!) Confluence Cloud instances will need to file a support request at https://support.atlassian.com to request we run this for you due to permission restrictions on both flushing cache and content indexing.
fields.summary: Caching problems can cause the option to create JIRA Issue from highlighting text to become missing

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35727].
  {panel}

h3. ***Summary***
Previously, whenever a  PDF file is opened, in the previous Confluence version the customer would be prompted to download the file, but now there's a preview on screen. With the recent [update on Confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/16+November+2014+to+21+November+2014#id-16November2014to21November2014-Confluence5.6-OD-37] users are forced to preview the PDF file.

h3. ***Improvement Request***
Customer's wants the ability to select whether or not to show the file in a preview mode.
 
A screenshot showing the actual behaviour.
!image.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Give the users the ability to select whether have or not the PDF preview mode on Confluence.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35723].
  {panel}

Once Confluence is on version 5.6.4 (or later versions), the following add-ons will be listed as incompatible with the next versions:


* Applinks Diagnostics Plugin: https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.applinks.applinks-diagnostics-plugin
* SSL for Confluence: https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.ssl
* Public Announcement Service: https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.pas
* IM Presence NG Plugin: https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/confluence.extra.impresence2

This is a request to update the version Matrix in Marketplace, so the users can use the plugins without reminders in the instance.
fields.summary: Update Matrix Version in Marketplace

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35718].
  {panel}

Product Requirements Index Page (Or manually created by the Page Properties Report Macro (with label = requirements) has an ability to list the Product Requirements Pages within a Space. This is done by inserting the Space Keys in the second field, "Restrict to spaces". 

*What is suggested*:
Be able to *Restrict to Parent Page* instead of *Restricted to spaces*.

*Why*:
Would be useful should there be several projects within one Space. For example:
Space A has the following Child Pages: 
# Project 1
## Project 1 version 1.1
## Project 1 version 1.2
# Project 2
# Project 3.

Let's say each version of Project 1 has a Product Requirement Page. Therefore, it would be nice if there is a Product Requirements Index Page within the page "Project 1", that would list all the product requirements pages which is restricted to Project 1 only.
fields.summary: Be able to have the options to list Product Requirements Page within a Parent Page instead of a Space

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35716].
  {panel}

Currently, the group can only be assigned by the Confluence Administrator. 

However, some organization that has high number of new user and volatile permission usage need a feature which allow the space admin to grant permission to their spaces to  a certain number of user.  It is not feasible to ask the administrator to make the changes and assign the user to the require group if the changes need to be done frequently. 

To illustrate this better, here's a  sample scenario:
# There is a group SPACE A
# Group A is allowed to view/edit the SPACE A
# User 11 is not a member of Group A
# User 11 try to access SPACE A
# User 11 is requested to join the Group A 
# User 11 provide the pass-code to signup
# User 11 is now added to the Group A and able to view and edit the pages in SPACE A
fields.summary: Allow user to signup into a group if they have the needed credential.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35714].
  {panel}

The *Confluence update check* feature on Confluence shows _bundled_ plugins as incompatible for new version as well, even though these plugins come along with the target Confluence installation.

The plugins are not compatible with the new version, indeed. However, since they are bundled plugins that come along with the target version, showing them as incompatible cause confusion to users that are planning to upgrade.

*Note:*
This only happens to those bundled plugins that were updated by the user.

*Steps to reproduce:*
# On a Confluence 5.4.4 for example, go under the _Confluence update check_ page
## Select _5.6.4_ under the _Check compatibility for update to:_ field
## Click on the _Check_ button
!img1.png|thumbnail!
# Now go to the _Manage add-ons_ page
!img2.png|thumbnail!
## Update the _Code Macro Plugin_
!img3.png|thumbnail!
# Go back to the _Confluence update check_ page and perform the first steps again
#* It will show the _Code Macro Plugin_ as _Incompatible_
!img4.png|thumbnail!

I've done this process with the _Support Tools Plugin_ as well:
!img5.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Update checker shows bundled plugin as incompatible

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35711].
  {panel}

h3. Reasoning:
When performing imports they can sometimes fail due to invalid characters in entities.xml. This requires manually stripping the characters (normally with a perl script) within the files and subsequently compressing them back. If the compression is done incorrectly (for example, a user compresses the containing directory and not the files themselves), the import then fails again due to being unable to find the exportDescriptor.properties file. This process (of fixing the entities.xml to remove invalid characters, compressing it, and then after it fails figuring out the correct way to compress the files) is extremely frustrating and time consuming for both customers and Atlassian Support.

h3. Specific Improvements:
- Strip invalid characters from entities.xml during import
- Look for export descriptor.properties recursively in the backup file (and not just in the top level)
fields.summary: XML Restore Improvements

fields.description:
https://docs.atlassian.com/confluence/REST/latest/#d3e855

In this documentation on labels the example URIs end in "labels" instead of "label".

Here is the current documentation:
 
GET
/rest/api/content/{id}/label?prefix&start&limit
Returns the list of labels on a piece of Content.

Example request URI(s):

http://example.com/rest/api/content/1234/labels
http://example.com/rest/api/content/1234/labels?prefix=global&start=0&limit=200

Here is what it should be:

GET
/rest/api/content/{id}/label?prefix&start&limit
Returns the list of labels on a piece of Content.

Example request URI(s):

http://example.com/rest/api/content/1234/label
http://example.com/rest/api/content/1234/label?prefix=global&start=0&limit=200
fields.summary: Error in rest api documentation for labels

fields.description:
When the indexing language is set to _Other_ Confluence will ignore the term _ancestorsIds_ in searches.

This also affect the pagetree search macro, as it uses _ancestorsIds_ in the search queries.
+Repro Steps:+
# Set Confluence indexing language to _Other_
# Do a search including the term _ancestorsIds_ in it. For example {{ancestorsIds:12345 AND foo}}; where {{12345}} is a page id.
fields.summary: ancestorIds ignored in search if indexing language is set to "Other"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35696].
  {panel}

The current Quick search on Confluence has no background set in the CSS at the moment. When the header background is set to black (#000); the quick search bar background becomes black as well; making the Quick search bar 'disappear' from view.

In JIRA; there is a gray 'SEARCH' text to indicate the position of the quick search bar; but in Confluence there is none (causing it to disappear from view).

In the previous version of Confluence; the .aui-quicksearch (batch.css) has property background-color: #FFF. The recent Confluence has however seems to have removed this and replace it with background: none repeat scroll 0% 0% rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.2); (which seems to have override background: none repeat scroll 0% 0% #F5F5F5; ) .

It might be better to change it back to the white/gray background so that it is more easily viewable.
fields.summary: Quicksearch bar on Confluence is missing background color attribute in CSS

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35695].
  {panel}

Example:
# GroupA has the following member:
#* GroupB
# GroupB has the following member:
#* UserA

Based on the above, UserA is the nested member of GroupA. GroupB is only a bridge used to link the nested membership between UserA and GroupA. It will be great if we have an option to hide GroupB (the subgroup) from all functions in Confluence, since some administrators will only be interested in GroupA. This creates a more organized UI, free from clutters of subgroups
fields.summary: Ability to hide subgroups in Nested Group relationships

fields.description:
I cannot get Space Categories to work correctly after manually adding them to Spaces. If I add a brand new category on a given space, it will also appear as a new Category tab on the Space Directory. However, clicking on that tab yields no results. If I add an existing Category, that tab will not show that Space in the results. Refreshing the Space Directory page doesn't fix it.

If a Category is added to a space *automatically*, such as "teams" Category auto-added when using the Team Space template, then the tab in the Space Directory ALWAYS works. It's only the manual add that fails.

This exact same issue exists if clicking on a Category label of a particular Space. Only the auto-added Spaces-Category associations are shown. Not the manual ones.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# On top menu, click *Spaces* -> *Space directory*
# On side menu, click *Site Spaces*
# Pick a Space and click on the circled "i" icon. This will bring you to *Space Details* -> *Space Operations* for that Space
# On side menu, click *GENERAL* -> *Space Categories*
# Type "test" into input text and click *Add*
# On top menu, click *Spaces* -> *Space directory*
# Notice *Test* has been added under *CATEGORIES* on side menu
# On side menu, click *CATEGORIES* -> *Test*
# Notice "No spaces found." appears in an Info macro.
fields.summary: Space Directory's Category tabs don't work

*Expected behaviour:*

*Actual behaviour:*
The group "confluence-users" is created in the Crowd user repository and the user is added for both group test and confluence-users.

The same behaviour is reproduce for other repository like LDAP and active directory.

fields.description:
We use Confluence to publish customer-facing documentation. Within that documentation, some repetitive data, that is likely to change at some point (such as e-mail adresses) are placed in snippet-pages, and then displayed using the Page Include macro.

This works quite nice, except when this include happens to be inside an Excerpt macro. The page using this Excerpt, does not render the text on the embedded page, instead it renders the name of the included page.

See attached example.

I can imagine there are limitations as to what can be part of an excerpt, but since it can include formatting like headers, tables and bullets, I would assume a simple page include would not pose a problem :).
fields.summary: Excerpt macro does not render Page Includes

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35684].
  {panel}

We are currently using the Content by Label Macro for our Multi Project Management. So we can distinguish by status of the dimensions quality, costs, time, customer satisfaction, etc.

So what we would like to have is a bunch of labels we can choose from a dropdown, such as: on target, out of scope or critical. As well we want to show them on the confluence page as a status in order to have a good project overview for one project. We need the labels to have the overview for a few projects.

A quick example:

Quality - On Target (Status) - ontarget (label)
Costs - Critical (Status) - critical (label)
Time - On Target (Status) - ontarget (label)
Customer Satisfaction - Focus (Status) - focus (label)

Is there going to be a feature for this in the near future?

fields.description:
Since recently upgrading Confluence to latest stable versions, pages with excerpt-include references to the page on which they are on no longer work correctly. Instead displaying the message...

Error rendering macro 'excerpt-include' : null

So, to clarify. Impacted pages have the "Excerpt Include" macro with the "Page Containing the Excerpt" parameter set to the current page, the very same page where the macro itself resides. Hope that makes sense.

Here's the source, looks like this could be an issue with the Macro Browser as the name parameter appears to be a null link. Hope this helps...

<ac:structured-macro ac:name="excerpt-include"><ac:parameter ac:name=""><ac:link /></ac:parameter></ac:structured-macro>
fields.summary: Pages including own excerpt show error rendering macro 'excerpt-include' : null

At the moment the only mechanism is through the use of an api function via user macros, which counts all pages including all versions of pages and deleted pages (findPageTotal).

https://docs.atlassian.com/confluence/latest/com/atlassian/confluence/spaces/SpaceManager.html#findPageTotal%28com.atlassian.confluence.spaces.Space%29

Counting the number of pages in a space is an important piece of meta data.

Maybe have an additional parameter to specify what to count?

fields.description:
On attempted import of a word document with some very long section headings the following error appears in the log:

2014-11-18 10:14:04,948 ERROR [ajp-bio-127.0.0.1-15279-exec-637] [sf.hibernate.impl.SessionImpl] execute Could not synchronize database state with session
 -- url: /confluence/pages/worddav/doimportword.action | page: 18189078 | userName: xxxxx | referer: https://srv.example.com/confluence/pages/worddav/importword.action | action: doimportword
2014-11-18 10:14:05,015 ERROR [ajp-bio-127.0.0.1-15279-exec-637] [atlassian.confluence.servlet.ConfluenceServletDispatcher] sendError Could not execute action
 -- url: /confluence/pages/worddav/doimportword.action | userName: xxxxx | referer: https://srv.example.com/confluence/pages/worddav/importword.action
org.springframework.jdbc.UncategorizedSQLException: Hibernate operation: could not insert: [com.atlassian.confluence.links.OutgoingLink#19038545]; uncategorized SQLException for SQL []; SQL state [72000]; error code [12899]; ORA-12899: value too large for column "DBUCONFLP01"."LINKS"."DESTPAGETITLE" (actual: 256, maximum: 255)
; nested exception is java.sql.SQLException: ORA-12899: value too large for column "DBUCONFLP01"."LINKS"."DESTPAGETITLE" (actual: 256, maximum: 255)

        at org.springframework.jdbc.support.AbstractFallbackSQLExceptionTranslator.translate(AbstractFallbackSQLExceptionTranslator.java:83)
        at org.springframework.orm.hibernate.HibernateAccessor.convertJdbcAccessException(HibernateAccessor.java:364)
--

This looks to me like the import function allows one character more than the length the database field was configured for. Perhaps this is an unaccounted-for terminator such as a linefeed.
fields.summary: Discrepancy between size of DESTPAGETITLE generated at word import and database contraints
Export Space - add option to exclude all prior versions of the page (s)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35665].
  {panel}

h2. Example
There are a large number of documents in Confluence with the same word in the title.  For this example, we will use the word *Test*.  (example - *Test Page*, *Page Test*, *Test Now*, *Test Later*, etc).  

If the quotation marks are omitted, the document you are searching for (*Test Page*) won't appear in the results. We would like that the search engine would assume the results from quotes around the entire phrase *"Test"* had they have been there to be worth more than the results without quotes, but continue to include both sets of results.

This is an issue for larger instances that have many documents with similar titles.  We would like to see the exact results of the search appear first in the list and then non-exact results.
fields.summary: Search returns results that match exact term first

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35663].
  {panel}

HipChat keeps my team from using email like an instance message service and we love it.  We also love Confluence, but we've found one issue.  Comments are not posted to HipChat rooms even when linked.  I've even tried the other Hipchat add-on which adds support for comments, but it doesn't provided any details.  It just states:

comment on 'Page' in Space by User

It would be huge for use, if it also displayed the comment.  
And even better, if you could tie together the hip chat @usernames with the confluence @usernames.
fields.summary: As a confluence and hip chat user, I would like a pages comments to show up in a linked hip chat room, so that I'm notified live of new comments,
